did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: Library of Virginia (Box 1046329 is located at the State Records Center.)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: York County (Va.) County Court Records, 1780-1877. Local government records collection, York County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court records from York County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: York County originally was named Charles River County, for King Charles I, and was one of the eight shires, or counties, first enumerated in 1634. A record of 7 January 1634 employs the name York County, and a statute of 1643 officially changed the name to York County, probably in honor of James, duke of York, the second son of King Chares I, and later King James II.
Recognized in 1634 as an original shire. Most pre-Revolutionary War-era loose records are missing. Volumes that record deeds, court orders, and wills exist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: York County (Va.) County Court Records, 1780-1877, consist of 5 boxes of Common Law Papers and Vouchers, 6 boxes of Court Suits and Papers and 3 boxes of Judgments.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional York County Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm."

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: York County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional York Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Digital Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localites Digital Collection available on Virginia Memory.
